summary: Saerwen is a Wood Elf follower found in the Winking Skeever in Solitude. RL Followers are intended to provide realistic-looking characters that fit into the world, as an alternative to the many glamazon, cartoonish, or anime-style followers available on the Nexus.
descriptionHtml:
RL Followers are intended to provide realistic-looking characters that fit into the world, as an alternative to the many glamazons, cartoonish, or anime-style followers available on the Nexus. They support immersion in that they don't wear makeup or lipstick, and in order to maximise compatibility they don't feature custom voices or scripting, so should work with any follower mod on any type of playthrough.

Saerwen is a Wood Elf follower found in the Winking Skeever in Solitude.

[heading][color=#FF8100]WHAT THIS MOD DOES[/color][/heading]
This mod simply alters armor, shields, clothing, circlets, amulets and rings
intended for adults so that they can be worn by child followers.

This mod has been cleaned with TES5Edit and contains no scripts.

The main file is an "all-in-one" combined patch that covers the main game
and the DLCs. If you don't have all the DLCs, individual patches are
available
for the vanilla game, Dragonborn, and Dawnguard DLCs in the Files section.

[heading][color=#FF8100]AVAILABLE OPTIONAL PATCHES[/color][/heading]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16438/?]Bandolier - Bags and Pouches[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/22119/?]Bandolier - Dawnguard[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/12092/?]Cloaks of Skyrim[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11163/?]Frostfall - Hypothermia Camping Survival[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19733/?]Immersive Armors[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27563/?]Wet & Cold[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/13486/?]Winter Is Coming - Cloaks[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53442/?]ZZJay's Wardrobe[/url]

Each patch has been developed to be "stand-alone", so you only need install
the ones you want. You don't even need the main mod file!

[heading][color=#FF8100]UPCOMING CUSTOM ARMOR PATCHES[/color][/heading]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52013/?]EotW Dovahkiins Journeyman Armor V2[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25113/?]Nordic Ranger Outfit[/url]

[heading][color=#FF8100]WHAT THIS MOD DOES NOT DO[/color][/heading]
This mod does not change the meshes or textures of any items.

The mod excludes any changes to the following items (for obvious reasons):

[list][*][size=2]Wedding outfits[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]The Amulet of Mara[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Tavern/"Wench" outfits[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Prisoner handcuffs[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Executioner Hood[/size][/*]
[/list]
It also does not provide for any skimpy armors or nudity. Nor will it ever.

[heading][color=#FF8100]REQUIREMENTS[/color][/heading]
The main file is a single .esp file and requires Skyrim.esm, Dawnguard.esm, and Dragonborn.esm.

Each additional patch is standalone, and does not require the main file. The
requirements of each patch are listed below the patch title in the
files section.

[heading][color=#FF8100]HOW TO GIVE ARMOR/CLOTHING TO KIDS[/color][/heading]
If you want to recruit your own apprentice, scribe, page, or any other kind of child follower, I'd strongly suggest [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/15524/?]Amazing Follower Tweaks[/url] and the following process:

[list][*][size=2]Adopt the child as per vanilla and allow them to travel to your home[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Visit your home and use the "AFT Make Follower" spell on them[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Select "Manage with AFT" from their dialogue options[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Select Tweak Menu > Gear > Manage Outfits from their dialogue options[/size][/*]
[*][size=2]Select Tweak Menu > Gear > Standard Outfit from their dialogue options in order to manage their armor and clothing[/size][/*]
[/list]
Other follower managers should provide this functionality, but your mileage
may vary. AFT and the above process are the ones I use, and know work.

[heading][color=#FF8100]RECOMMENDED MODS[/color][/heading]
I'd strongly recommend this mod in use with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55555/?]RS Children Overhaul[/url], because it gives Skyrim's children a much more realistic look, rather
than a collection of potato heads (Bethesda, what were you thinking?).

If you'd prefer your small companions to fight alongside you, rather than running and hiding, I'd recommend the excellent [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23030/?]Make Any Child Your Follower[/url]. Just make sure to tell them to be brave! I still recommend "recruiting"
them with "Amazing Follower Tweaks" if you recruit them using "Make Any
Child Your Follower" however, in order to better manage their
inventory, outfits, and them as followers. The two work very well
together!

[heading][color=#FF8100]CHILD MOD COMPATIBILITY[/color][/heading]
Tested compatible:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55555/?]RS Children Overhaul (and playable children's race)[/url] - Caution: Some outfits may cause a neck seam on male children. This is
an issue with the vanilla mesh and beyond the ability of this mod to
correct, sorry!

Should be compatible:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34723/?]Adoptable Argonian Hatchling - Chases-Starlight[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26671/?]My little hatchling Ram-Ku-Argonian boy[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/26445/?]My little kitty Ma-Rakha-Khajiit boy[/url]

Please provide feedback in the Posts section if you have experience either way!

Not compatible:
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25654/?]KhajiitChild Maisha[/url] (as she uses a custom race - sorry!)

[heading][color=#FF8100]HOW TO INSTALL[/color][/heading]
Download and activate as per normal with NMM, or extract the included "Armor and
Clothing for Kids.esp" into your Skyrim\Data folder and activate. Then
sort your load order with LOOT. Easy!

[heading][color=#FF8100]REPORTING BUGS[/color][/heading]
If you find any of the armor or clothing pieces that are invisible when
worn by a child, please take the following steps, which will allow you
to give me the information I need to fix it.

1. Open the console with the tilde (`) key (top-left of the keyboard)
2. Type: help "name of the armor piece as it appears in your inventory" and hit Enter (the braces/brackets are required)
3. The armor piece will be listed, and to it's left will be a code like "0A0001234" - This is the item's FormID
4. Post the name and FormID of the armor in the Posts section!

[heading][color=#FF8100]FURTHER DEVELOPMENT[/color][/heading]
Except for bug fixes, (and depending on how interesting some user requests are) I'm considering this mod complete!

[heading][color=#FF8100]PERMISSIONS[/color][/heading]
There's no original content here (just an original idea and a whole heap of
Creation Kit work!), so no need to ask to use anything from this mod. Go
right ahead and repackage/reuse it - just make sure you add some value
to it (and a little credit for the inspiration would be appreciated)!

I plan on supporting and extending this mod for some time to come, but if
it ends up "abandoned" for whatever reason, and someone is enthusiastic
enough, feel free to pick up where I left off!

[heading][color=#FF8100]CREDITS[/color][/heading]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/5134496/?tb=mods&pUp=1]Shockero[/url],  [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/1251063/?tb=mods&pUp=1]Stealthic Khaos[/url],  and [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/4559665/?tb=mods&pUp=1]Kalilies[/url] for putting together the KS Hairdos - 265 pack!

author: PlagueHush
